Posts.Content: Aug 24, 2013 09:06AM - edited Aug 24, 2013 09:07AM by PeachRunner I have had mammograms for the last 5 years; always normal. I had my annual mammo last month where they find tightly clustered microcalcifications too. I was a wreck; in a panic. Then they did a magnified mammogram on me a few days after that; still undetermined, and so they suggested a biopsy. That scared me. So IÂ  did a stereotactic biopsy a few days later. I got my results within 48 hours; benign. Fibrocystic breasts. Best of luck!! Praying for B9!!!! EDITED TO SAY: Just saw your results!! Yayyyyyy!!!!!!!!!! :D

Posts.Content: Aug 24, 2013 11:55AM PeachRunner wrote: It doesn't hurt during the procedure. You are numbed. All I felt was the weird pressure but no pain. However; afterwards (maybe the next day) I was sore and 3 1/2 weeks later it is still tender.
